title: Facebook returns to chronological news feed after decade-long hiatus
text: Facebook, the social networking site owned by Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB), confirmed it will reinstate a chronological news feed to ensure users can keep up with posts from their friends. “One of the most requested features for Facebook is to make sure people don't miss friends' posts,” Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg commented, “so today we're launching a Feeds tab where you can see posts from your friends, groups, pages and more separately in chronological order.

BAC, +1.01% , and Barclays PLC BCS, +1.91% to arrange calls with potential investors.

title: Facebook is shutting down its live shopping feature on October 1

title: Facebook parent Meta launches first ever corporate bond offering
text: Meta Platforms Inc. META, +5.37% launched its first ever corporate bond offering on Thursday, without disclosing either the size of the deal or its pricing.
